blog.title: AO3feed-Jonrya
blog.description: An automated feed for Jon x Arya fics posted on AO3.

title: Starks Will Come Again
description:
by Aryas_aria

Jon Snow awakes on the Wall, changed but still very much committed to freeing “Arya” from the Boltons. Catching wind of Jon’s resurrection, Littlefinger plots to use him to secure Sansa’s seat in Winterfell, but he isn’t the only one with eyes on the North. Back in the Riverlands, a fugitive Brynden Tully finds a mysterious grey- eyed girl at the Twins as Bran Stark returns from Beyond the Wall. Meanwhile, Cersei Lannister rules from King’s Landing as three Dragons circle the island of Dragonstone. The seven kingdoms are at war and the Night King is coming. Will they be able to band together and defeat the Night king for good? Or will the iron Throne be the death of them all?

Words: 919, Chapters: 1/?, Language: English

  • Fandoms: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Graphic Depictions Of Violence, Major Character Death, Underage
  • Categories: F/M
  • Characters: Jon Snow, Arya Stark, Sansa Stark, Bran Stark, Rickon Stark, Robb Stark (mentioned) - Character, Ned Stark ( mentioned), Catelyn Tully Stark, Lady Stoneheart, Edmure Tully, The Blackfish, Brynden Tully, Tyrion Lannister, Jamie Lannister, Cersei Lannister, Olenna Tyrell, Willas Tyrell, Margaery Tyrell, Ned Dayne, Arianne Martell, Tyene Sand, Beric Dondarrion (mentioned), Thoros of Myr, Brotherhood Without Banners, Brother(s) of the Night’s Watch, Samwell Tarley, Jon “The Greatjon” Umber, Sandor Clegane, Jon “The Smalljon” Umber, Robert “Sweetrobin” Arryn, Petyr Baelish, Shireen Baratheon, Gendry Waters, Selyse Baratheon, Melisandre of Asshai, Daenerys Targaryen, Aegon VI Targaryen, Theon Greyjoy, Asha Greyjoy, Jaqen H'ghar, The Faceless Man, Gregor Clegane, Brienne of Tarth, Poderick Payne
  • Relationships: Jon Snow/Arya Stark, Jon Snow/Daenerys Targaryen (somewhat), Tyrion Lannister/Sansa Stark, Aegon VI Targaryen/Daenerys Targaryen, Shireen Baratheon/ Gendry waters, Cersei Lannister/ Jaime Lannister
  • Additional Tags: Jon Snow is a Targaryen, Slow Burn, Jon Snow is not called Aegon, aegon is a pretender, Sansa is redeemable, Arya stark is more than a weapon, Arya-centric, Faceless Arya, bran is more than just a three eyed raven, Bran has EMOTIONS & feelings, The Hound has been redeemed, Cersei is evil but we love her for it, Rickon stark is a live and an important member of house stark

tags: a song of ice and fire
summary: Anthems for a Seventeen Year Old Girl - stilinskitrash - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
title: Anthems for a Seventeen Year Old Girl - stilinskitrash - Game of Thrones (TV) [Archive of Our Own]
excerpt: An Archive of Our Own, a project of the Organization for Transformative Works
description:
Chapters: 1/1
Fandom: Game of Thrones (TV), A Song of Ice and Fire - George R. R. Martin
Rating: Teen And Up Audiences
Warnings: Creator Chose Not To Use Archive Warnings
Relationships: Arya Stark/Gendry Waters, Jon Snow & Gendry Waters
Characters: Gendry Waters, Arya Stark, Jon Snow, Sansa Stark
Additional Tags: Childhood Friends, Enemies to Lovers, Angst, Recreational Drug Use, Alcohol, College, Alternate Universe - Modern Setting, Crushes, Underage Smoking, Making Out
Summary:

Before college, boys were all just like her brothers. Which was to say, more tolerable than a lot of the girls in her classes, not many of which seemed to ever like Arya. Now she was irritated by how cute the boy a few rows in front of her in history class was, and the how she’d developed all these other feelings that she hadn’t been fussed with in secondary school.

Gendry Waters was no exception. In fact, she blamed him; he’d been a catalyst in these new revelations, hanging around their house every week looking like that.

summary: what do you think of *some people* who claim that sansa is lyanna in spirit?
question: what do you think of *some people* who claim that sansa is lyanna in spirit?
answer:
Hahaha. Yeah. The same people who can claim she’s lady alysanne in spirit, rhaenys in spirit or Naerys in spirit or or or-

Somersault bend and twist as many miniscule points as you want to fit what you want, have fun, sure, but to me Lyanna is glaringly arya ‘in spirit’, and for Sansa, she has their mother Cat as her ‘spirit’ (this term is kind of weird but we all know what we mean).

Lyanna’s name doesn’t come up one single time in Sansa’s chapters, and 4 times in arya chapters, and other characters consistently relate arya to Lyanna, which makes it a purposeful comparison from GRRM himself. GRRM also purposefully compares Sansa to Cat, something Arya does not get. Other links and parallels to lots of other characters can be made with some digging or some creativity or some damn far reaching BUT these parallels for the girls are the clearest in the actual narrative.

The only thing I can link between Sansa and lyanna myself is that they are both romantics and like songs. She has none of Lyanna’s recklessness though. Sansa has the opposite trait of recklessness, Sansa will ‘behave herself’ and go along with others, and her own strength is being able to do this and navigate her way through it safely. She is slow, watchful and cautious and all about self preservation. Whereas Arya is reckless (I don’t mean that word in a negative way, it’s an adventurous heroine trait). Lyanna also has strong associations with the north and all its traits, like Arya, whereas Sansa has traits associated with the south, like Cat.

All together i think people kind of have to IGNORE a lot of what Sansa is actually like to associate her with Lyanna, which irritates me, and then they cling to one or two points (songs and running away from a marriage) and build those up to be bigger than they are to eclipse the MORE OBVIOUS parallels to Arya.

Just one example to be summative.

“You ride like a northman, milady,” Harwin said when he’d drawn them to a halt. “Your aunt was the same. Lady Lyanna. But my father was master of horse, remember.”- Arya, ASOS

“I hate riding,” Sansa said fervently. “All it does is get you soiled and dusty and sore.”- Sansa, AGOT

title: PSA
body:
Just your daily reminder that all the Stark siblings loved each other and miss each other, even if they didn’t always get along. That includes Sansa and Arya. That includes Sansa and Arya. That includes Sansa and Arya.

THAT INCLUDES SANSA AND ARYA

summary: Always No One. Game Of Thrones Imagine
title: Always No One. Game Of Thrones Imagine
body:
Imagine: You are no one. You’ve never known anything but no one. You befriend Arya Stark, who is absolutely shit at being no one. 

Notes: Nothing of trigger warnings. This is to be read in any person point of view, but with the mindset of not using ‘I’ or ‘me’, like a no one person would. 

If a girl were to recall a life before now, it would be very hard to tell. It was easy to describe; all that was before now, was nothing. A girl remembers nothing before where she is now. A man found her on the shore of Braavos; young, barely seven name days into the world. She was small and bony, skin burned from the sun, hair tangled like the weeds of the sea. She was confused, and scared, and hungry, and alone. Not even able to remember her own name. A girl was childish, but no more is she those things. A girl is older, wiser, stronger. Perhaps not knowing who she was, made it easy for a girl to become No One. A girl has killed, all for and in the name of the Many-Faced God.

A girl cannot remember a time when her feelings gave way. When her emotions seeped through the cracks of her own hands, crashing into her chest and playing with her head. She remembers the first time she felt something. It was the first time she had sat with the girl named Arya Stark, a Lady of Winterfell in Westeros. A girl sat with Arya, playing the game. A game a girl was very good at.

“What is a girl’s name?” A girl questions, voice even as they sat before each other on the floor of Arya Stark’s own chambers. A girl held her staff in hand, a light grip as she waited.

“A girl is No One.” A girl’s finger twitched, sensing the lie, but let it slide. A girl wondered how good of a liar Arya Stark would be, if given the chance to surpass her own name in this game.

“Where is a girl from?”

“A girl is from Winterfell; her father was a proud man. The blacksmith of Winterfell.” Obviously, a lie. A girl struck Arya in the side, sending her the opposite way. “A girl is the daughter of Eddard Stark, Lord of Winterfell.” A girl struck her again, resulting in Arya’s anger. “That’s not a lie!”

“Eddard Stark is dead. He is not Lord of Winterfell. He was.” A girl explains, turning the staff in her hands as it lied in her lap. She tilts her head, “What once was, does mean what is. Continue.”

Arya rolls her shoulders, relaxing before continuing her story. As a girl listened, slapping the lies away with her staff, quietly accepting the truths; she felt something. A fondness, in her chest, grow for the Stark girl. Arya was small, but she was stubborn. A trait that was admirable to a girl. A girl relished in the fact she was able to be a positive figure to Arya. Arya asked her questions, and spoke to her, and asked her to teach her to fight. A girl found herself seeking the Stark’s company on most occasions; working together, training, spending free time together. Once Arya was rendered blind, for disobeying, a girl found herself helping the poor Stark. She took food and water to her, quietly offering it, never speaking to her much. She watched from affair when the waif would come and strike her a few times before vanishing. A girl found herself offering to train Arya, getting her use to the darkness of her world.

Waif was cruel, crueler than what was necessary. A girl found herself hating the actions brought against Arya. It was strange, but she found she had a thick, yucky feeling in her throat whenever Arya was mistreated, and a heat under her skin when Waif smirked down at the girl with malicious intent. She never spoke of it, feeling it was something that would pass. It never did. And once Arya killed the Waif, and left, a girl went with her.

A girl arrived at the docks, wearing dark boots that matched her dark trousers, a deep red shirt with long puffed sleeves, a thick belt wrapped around her waist with dark leather arm bands around her forearms. A girl’s thick hair was braided and out of the way, and her staff was held in her belt behind her.

“Arya Stark.” The Stark whips around, sword at the ready. Spotting the familiar face, Arya relaxes just a little.

“I am leaving.”

“A girl knows and understands.”

Arya frowns. “Then why are you here?”

“A girl…wishes to leave as well. A girl wants to follow Arya Stark.” A girl stood tall, hands behind her back as she stated the words firmly. Arya’s thick brows furrowed, confusion flooding her being before she puts her sword back inside its sheath, attaching it to her waist.

“I’m going to kill the queen.”

“A girl thought as much.”

Arya narrowed her eyes, tilting her head. “You want to give up your faith? Be a person and not No One.”

A girl looks down, biting the inside of her cheek. “Yes. A girl wishes to be herself.”

“You’ll need to stop talking like that, unless you want to give us away.” Arya comments, leading them into the city. “Is that your actual face?”

“No.” A girl answers simply, “A girl has not seen her own face in many years.”

“How many faces are you wearing?”

“Just this one.” Arya nods, hand on the hilt of her sword as she strolled through the streets.

“What is your real name? If you aren’t a no one anymore.”

“A girl never had a name.” Arya does not look convinced. “A girl washed up on the beach as a child, and a man brought her into the House of Black and White. She has always been a No One. A girl never knew her name or her home.”

“Do you want a name?” Arya asks, and a girl pauses, not sure of what to say. “Show me your true face.” A girl hesitates, before sliding the tips of her fingers under the skin and pulling the face away. Arya looked at her friend. A young woman stood before her, about a few inches taller than herself, with tanned skin and freckles scattered over her nose and cheeks. Her bottom lip was larger, but not in a strange way. Her brows were arched, and dark, matching the hair she had before. Her eyes were brown, almost black, and almond shaped. Her lashes long and fluttered as she blinked at Arya. Her button nose was cute, adding a young look to her friend’s natural face.

“You look like an Y/n, can I call you Y/n?” Arya questions and the girl thinks before nodding.

“I am Y/n.” Arya gives a smirk as her friend tries out her name. “Friend of Arya Stark of Winterfell.”
body_abstract:
Imagine: You are no one. You’ve never known anything but no one. You befriend Arya Stark, who is absolutely shit at being no one. 

Notes: Nothing of trigger warnings. This is to be read in any person point of view, but with the mindset of not using ‘I’ or ‘me’, like a no one person would. 

If a girl were to recall a life before now, it would be very hard to tell. It was easy to describe; all that was before now, was nothing. A girl remembers nothing before where she is now. A man found her on the shore of Braavos; young, barely seven name days into the world. She was small and bony, skin burned from the sun, hair tangled like the weeds of the sea. She was confused, and scared, and hungry, and alone. Not even able to remember her own name. A girl was childish, but no more is she those things. A girl is older, wiser, stronger. Perhaps not knowing who she was, made it easy for a girl to become No One. A girl has killed, all for and in the name of the Many-Faced God.

summary:

Arya: well, I have this headache that comes and goes
Lommy: *appears* hi guys!
Arya: there it is...
body:
Gendry: hey arry. How are you?

Arya: well, I have this headache that comes and goes

Lommy: *appears* hi guys!

Arya: there it is again

blog.name: first-of-her-nxme
blog.title: I see you, wolf child. Blood child

summary: Isn't Jaqen too old for Arya ? Gendry is closer in age to her
question: Isn't Jaqen too old for Arya ? Gendry is closer in age to her
answer:
Book spoilers

Bookwise Jaqen is 18 years old. The age gap between Jaqen, Arya and Gendry is the same as between Rhaegar, Lyanna and Robert. In Westeros “a man grown” is a boy as young as 16 years old, that’s why Gendry is often described as “almost a man” or “the closest thing to a man.” Jaqen refers to himself as “a man” like Loras does but Jaime thinks Loras is still a boy. The same goes for Jon, Sam and Pate. Technically they all are “the men grown” but they are still teenagers. GRRM gives away Pate’s age in A Feast for Crows to let us know how old Jaqen is.

In the show we are talking about two grown up actors performing their roles not actual people starting a relationship. Usually actors portray characters younger than themselves. In many high school themed shows/movies the main characters are played by the actors well in their twenties. We can assume that in the show Jaqen is a seasoned assassin who may fall for a young but adult apprentice. Arya is a grown up girl in the show and so is Maisie. I don’t see anything wrong about it as long as the relationship is consensual and people involved are adults. 

Thank you for the question :)
